column4: i think internet sharing doesnt work because ubuntu doesnt even recognize my ethernet.. what do i do? god..
is the network interface showing with the command: ifconfig?
its all perfectly possible
but its not particularly simple stuff
do you know how though?
yeah pretty much, you can run dnsmasq for dhcp and dns, and then route traffic via your wifi

its on of those things, linux is perfect for this job - it can do pretty much any networking magic you could ever think of, but on the flip side its never as simple as you would like, and you just need to put in the time reading documentation and understanding networks in general
does your ethernet port show a link light?
that guide is esactly what you want to do
i followed that guide though
are you usinga  special cross-over cable?
are you using a hub or switch between the two pc's or are you connecting computer directly to computer?
directly to computer
does this cable work udner windows?
usualy if your connecting a computer directly to another computer you would need a crossover cable, but this applies to windows too
since it worked on windows could it work on ubantu
unless as yagoo implied it can be managed or set these days
well yeah, it should - but the driver level autocrossing of the pairs is news to me
if you have no link light between the machines thats at the datalink level
ie its not related to linux or windows
and you need to sort out the cabling
